revised_title: On the Mechanical Properties of Glass: Resistance to Collapse and Tensile Strength
tldr: This article investigates the mechanical properties of glass, including its resistance to collapse and tensile strength. Experiments were conducted on three types of glass, and the results showed that the resistance of glass cylinders to compression follows a similar law as sheet iron cylinders. The tensile strength of glass bars was found to be smaller than when burst by internal pressure in the form of thin globes.
